\Aura\Session

\Aura\SessionManager

A central control point for new session segments, PHP session management values, and CSRF token checking.

newSegment()

newSegment(string $name) : \Aura\Session\Segment

Gets a new session segment instance by name. Segments with the same name will be different objects but will reference the same $_SESSION values, so it is possible to have two or more objects that share state.

For good or bad, this a function of how $_SESSION works.

Parameters

string $name

The name of the session segment, typically a fully-qualified class name.

Returns

\Aura\Session\Segment

Tags

todo

setCookieParams()

setCookieParams(array $params) : void

Sets the session cookie params. Param array keys are:

  • lifetime : Lifetime of the session cookie, defined in seconds.

  • path : Path on the domain where the cookie will work.

    Use a single slash ('/') for all paths on the domain.

  • domain : Cookie domain, for example 'www.php.net'.

    To make cookies visible on all subdomains then the domain must be prefixed with a dot like '.php.net'.

  • secure : If TRUE cookie will only be sent over secure connections.

  • httponly : If set to TRUE then PHP will attempt to send the httponly

    flag when setting the session cookie.

Parameters

array $params

The array of session cookie param keys and values.

See also

Tags

todo

regenerateId()

regenerateId() : bool

bool —

True is regeneration worked, false if not.

getStatus()

getStatus() : int

Returns the current session status:

  • PHP_SESSION_DISABLED if sessions are disabled.
  • PHP_SESSION_NONE if sessions are enabled, but none exists.
  • PHP_SESSION_ACTIVE if sessions are enabled, and one exists.

Returns

int

See also
